properties.areaDesc: Ruby Mountains and East Humboldt Range; Northern Elko County
properties.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 11 at 2:45PM PST until January 11 at 10:00PM PST by NWS Elko NV
properties.description:
* WHAT...Winter Weather Advisory in effect. Additional snow
accumulations of 1 to 2 inches expected in lower valleys, 2 to 3
inches across higher terrain. Winds gusting as high as 45 mph
will cause areas of blowing snow.

* WHERE...Northern Elko County and Ruby Mountains/East Humboldt
Range.

* WHEN...Winter Weather Advisory in effect until 10 pm this
evening.

* ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Travel could be problematic, especially
along SR-225 and US-93. Plan on slippery road conditions. Gusty
winds could lead to blowing snow causing significantly reduced
visibilities.

* WHAT...Winter Storm Watch has been issued. Heavy snow possible.
Total snow accumulations of 3 to 6 inches in the valleys with
up to 20 inches possible in the mountains. possible. Winds could
gust as high as 45 mph.

* WHERE...Northern Elko County and Ruby Mountains/East Humboldt
Range.

* WHEN...Winter Storm Watch from Sunday afternoon through Tuesday
afternoon.

* ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Travel could be very difficult. The
hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening
commute. Gusty winds could bring down tree branches.
properties.instruction:
A Winter Weather Advisory for snow means periods of snow will
cause primarily travel difficulties. Expect snow covered roads
and limited visibilities, and use caution while driving.

A Winter Storm Watch means there is potential for significant
snow, sleet or ice accumulations that may impact travel. Continue
to monitor the latest forecasts.

The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can
be obtained by calling 5 1 1.

NWSheadline: WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 PM PST THIS EVENING... ...WINTER STORM WATCH IN EFFECT FROM SUNDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH TUESDAY AFTERNOON
